content:
Robert C. Martin says that Agile is a small idea about the small problem of small programming teams doing small things.
Agile is not a big idea about the big problem of big programming teams doing big things.
Big things don’t get done by big teams; big things get done by the collaboration of many small teams doing many small things.
To help popularize this, back in the early 2000s, the idea was given a name. “Agile.”

title: Agile Is a Small Idea

content:
Agile works well for projects that have:
A low cost of change Problems that are discovered along the way. Informally specified goals, that could alter. A more traditional approach might be a better option when:
The cost of change is high. The complete set of problems are known up-front. The goals are very specific and fully understood from the start.
summary:
Agile works well for projects that have:

  • A low cost of change
  • Problems that are discovered along the way.
  • Informally specified goals, that could alter.

A more traditional approach might be a better option when:

  • The cost of change is high.
  • The complete set of problems are known up-front.
  • The goals are very specific and fully understood from the start.
title: Which Projects Work Well With Agile?
